messages.title: The honourable gentleman comes to this house week after week to talk about the NHS in Kent
messages.content: David Cameron complaining about Mark at Prime Minister's Questions on 21/1/15

messages.title: Personal Message
messages.content: I always answer directly to you — not to party bosses in London. Defending public services in Rochester and Strood is my priority.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP will fund this with some of the £3 Billion extra NHS funding we will get by cutting international aid spending and EU payments.

My father is a doctor, my mother worked as a nurse in the NHS, and I believe my record as your MP shows that I am 100% for the NHS. UKIP believes that the NHS must remain free to use, and we will oppose attempts to charge people to see a GP.
UKIP will defend winter fuel payments, bus passes and TV licences for older folk.
UKIP is on the side of ordinary people, not cartel banks and crony energy companies.
Only UKIP will give us an Australian-style points based immigration system.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Mark can keep David Cameron's candidate out of Rochester and Strood. Only UKIP can win back the Tories in Rochester and Strood. A vote for Labour, rather than Mark, helps Cameron's Conservative candidate.

issues.health: Defending public services in Rochester and Strood is my priority.
issues.immigration: Only UKIP will give us an Australian-style points based immigration system.
issues.socialWelfare: UKIP will defend winter fuel payments, bus passes and TV licences for older folk.

leaflet.personalStatement: I always answer directly to you — not to party bosses in London. Defending public services in Rochester and Strood is my priority.

quotes.text: The honourable gentleman comes to this house week after week to talk about the NHS in Kent
quotes.source: David Cameron at Prime Minister's Questions on 21/1/15

images.caption: By-Election Result 2014 showing Mark Reckless with 42%, Conservative with 35%, and Labour with 16%

leaflet.additionalNotes: P.S. Only UKIP can beat the Tories in Rochester and Strood. A vote for Labour, rather than Mark, helps Cameron's Conservative candidate.
